  • Pan-fried salmon

Pan-fried salmon

  • Esther Clark
A star rating of 4.6 out of 5.54 ratingsRate
loading...
Gift a magazine subscription with 12 issues for £34.99
  • Preparation and cooking time
    • Prep:1 min
    • Cook:5 mins
  • Easy
  • Serves 2

Have a perfectly cooked salmon fillet, complete with crisp skin, ready in under 10 minutes. Serve with a side of buttery, seasonal green veg for a filling supper

  • Egg-free
  • Gluten-free
  • High-protein
  • Low sugar
  • Nut-free
Advertisement
Skip to ingredients

Showing items 1 to 3 of 3

Long-stem broccoli with sesame
A star rating of 4 out of 5.3 ratings

Add a shot of colour to your meal with this bright and fresh side dish from John Torode

Herby broccoli
A star rating of 4.3 out of 5.4 ratings

Jazz up a plate of broccoli with a couple of Italian ingredients

Springtime peas & greens
A star rating of 4.6 out of 5.9 ratings

Soya beans, asparagus, broad beans and peas tossed in a vinaigrette make a delicious springtime accompaniment to roast lamb

  • 2 x 150g salmon fillets
    (about 4cm thick), skin on
  • ½ tbsp olive oil
  • 20g unsalted butter
  • ½ lemon
    juiced

Nutrition: per serving

  • kcal386
  • fat29g
  • saturates9g
  • carbs0.2g
  • sugars0.2g
    low
  • fibre0.07g
  • protein31g
    high
  • salt0.15g
    low

Method

  • step 1

    Generously season the salmon fillets with salt and pepper. Put the oil and butter in a non-stick frying pan over a medium heat, swirling around the pan until melted and foaming, then turn up the heat. Once the butter starts bubbling, add the salmon fillets to the pan, skin-side-down, and fry for 3 mins until crisp. Flip the fillets over, lower the heat and cook for 2 mins more, then drizzle with the lemon juice. Transfer the salmon to a plate and baste with any of the buttery juices left in the pan.
